text: eGFR below 60 for more than 3 months is indicative of CKD.
full_context: According to the KDIGO 2012 guidelines, Chronic Kidney Disease (CKD) is defined as abnormalities of kidney structure or function, present for more than 3 months, with implications for health. One of the criteria includes eGFR less than 60 mL/min/1.73 mÂ² for more than 3 months.

text: Nephrotic syndrome is characterized by proteinuria over 3.5g/day.
full_context: Nephrotic syndrome is a clinical condition characterized by heavy proteinuria (typically more than 3.5g/day), hypoalbuminemia, hyperlipidemia, and edema. It reflects significant glomerular disease.
